questions.meaning: A ghost or spirit; something that appears to exist but has no physical reality
questions.sample_sentence: The old castle was said to be haunted by a phantom that appeared every midnight in the tower room.

questions.meaning: A small tower, especially one at the corner of a building or castle
questions.sample_sentence: The princess looked out from the turret of the medieval castle and watched the knights return from battle.

questions.meaning: Past tense of 'smite'; struck or hit with force
questions.sample_sentence: The thunder smote the old oak tree, splitting it in half during the terrible storm last night.

questions.meaning: Chewed or bit upon noisily; munched
questions.sample_sentence: The hungry horse champed the fresh hay eagerly after the long journey through the countryside.

questions.meaning: Covered with or full of ferns (a type of leafy plant)
questions.sample_sentence: We walked through the ferny forest path, where green ferns grew abundantly on both sides.

questions.meaning: Crowding together in large numbers; gathering densely
questions.sample_sentence: Thousands of fans were thronging the stadium entrance, eager to watch the final match of the cricket series.

questions.meaning: Lived or resided in a place
questions.sample_sentence: The ancient tribe dwelt in the valley for centuries before migrating to the coastal regions.

questions.meaning: The quality of being still; absence of movement or sound; complete quiet
questions.sample_sentence: The stillness of the library was broken only by the occasional turning of pages by the students.

questions.meaning: Confused and puzzled; unable to understand something
questions.sample_sentence: The students were perplexed by the complex mathematical problem that their teacher had given them to solve.

questions.meaning: A metal loop that hangs from a horse's saddle to support the rider's foot
questions.sample_sentence: The rider placed his foot in the stirrup and swung himself onto the saddle of his magnificent Arabian horse.

questions.meaning: Moved suddenly and powerfully forward or upward, like a wave
questions.sample_sentence: The crowd surged forward when the gates opened, everyone eager to get the best seats for the concert.

questions.meaning: Falling or moving suddenly and forcefully downward or forward
questions.sample_sentence: The waterfall was plunging from the cliff into the deep pool below, creating a magnificent spray of water.

questions.meaning: The quality of being shadowy; full of shadows; dark and indistinct
questions.sample_sentence: The shadowiness of the old mansion made it difficult to see clearly as we explored its abandoned rooms.

questions.meaning: Solitary; standing alone; without companions
questions.sample_sentence: A lone traveler walked along the deserted road as the sun began to set behind the mountains.

questions.meaning: Strange and frightening; mysterious in an unsettling way
questions.sample_sentence: An eerie silence fell over the forest at midnight, making the campers feel uneasy in their tents.

questions.meaning: Listening attentively; paying attention to sounds
questions.sample_sentence: The detective was hearkening to every word the witness said, hoping to find a clue in the testimony.

questions.meaning: An archaic past tense of 'speak'; spoke
questions.sample_sentence: The wise old man spake words of wisdom that the young villagers would remember for years to come.

questions.meaning: Repeating or reverberating sound; reflecting sound waves
questions.sample_sentence: Her laughter kept echoing through the empty corridor, bouncing off the stone walls of the ancient building.

questions.meaning: Illuminated by the light of the moon
questions.sample_sentence: The couple walked hand in hand along the moonlit beach, enjoying the peaceful evening by the sea.

questions.meaning: A large number of people or things; a multitude
questions.sample_sentence: A host of butterflies emerged from the garden, creating a colorful display against the blue sky.
